page.title: 13LAND RECLAIMATION
page.content: There are many coal tips overlooking towns and villages in our area. Where they look like becoming a danger or are a real eyesore, the{Welsh {Development Agency and the National {Coal Board}have landscaped some of the tips with big machines.They have been lowered and spread evenly over the hillside and drainage channels put in. Grass and trees have then been planted to make them look attractive. People in our area are very much concerned about tips overlooking their towns.In{Aberfan in October 1966}a coal tip did in fact slide down the side of a mountain straight into a school.{150 people were killed most of {them children.}Since that time people are more aware of the dangers and are not prepared to put up with this threat.
